context: The word 'näeme' is the 1st person plural form of the Estonian verb 'nägema', which means 'to see' or 'to look'. In this specific form (näeme), it translates to 'we see'. This is a present tense indicative form commonly used in everyday conversation. The root component 'näe-' comes from the stem of the verb, while '-me' is the 1st person plural ending in Estonian conjugation.
